list_definition.definition: a cabinet of any size up to that of a small room for storing anything; closet American

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Put the food in the cupboard

list_ex_of_english: They are not the sort of people who suddenly appear out of cupboards.
The cupboards were dirty and in a state of disrepair.
Of course files, whether in dirty cupboards or in old drawers, are always accessible to the criminal.
The cupboards which, a year ago, were bare, now, we are told, were indecently over-stocked.
Of course, there can be skeletons in cupboards as well.
We are not exactly living in cupboards, but we are very restricted for accommodation.
The floors of the bank were of course pulled up in order to search for documents, and locked doors and cupboards were broken.
Among the patients involved are what are called "shopping list patients", whose doctors are being induced to stock up the patients' medicine cupboards.
